ghost

Class Ghost

  • java.lang.Object
    • ghost.GameObject
      • ghost.Movable
        • ghost.Ghost
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Ambusher, Chaser, Ignorant, Whim

    public abstract class Ghost
extends Movable
    An abstract class for which the types of ghost extend from. Ghosts chase Waka around the map in chase mode, and in scatter mode, they target their home corner (depending on the type of ghost). Waka loses a life if hit by a ghost. If Waka has collected a superfruit, they will become frightened, and ghosts die if hit by Waka during this time. They move at random at intersections when frightened.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

      enum containing the possible Ghost modes.

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        public void draw()
        Draws the ghost with either the normal sprite or the frightened sprite, depending on the ghost's mode.
        Specified by:
        draw in class GameObject

      • tick

        public void tick()
        Runs the ghost's logic. If the ghost is frightened, run the frightened timer. If the ghost is alive, it should be drawn, and if debug mode is on, a line from the ghost to the player should also be drawn. If the ghost is at an intersection, it will recalculate the best direction to travel in to reach its target. It then moves in the said direction, and updates its collision borders.
        Specified by:
        tick in class GameObject

      • setCollisionBorders

        public void setCollisionBorders()
        Sets the collision borders for the ghost depending on the current x and y coordinates.
        Specified by:
        setCollisionBorders in class Movable

      • drawTargetLine

        public void drawTargetLine()
        Draws lines to target location from the ghost

      • selectDirection

        public void selectDirection()
        Sets the direction of travel based on generation of next move. Passes in the player or the corner coordinates to get this set direction. See functions generateNextMove(int, int) for more information.

      • selectMode

        public void selectMode()
        Selects mode based on timer and mode lengths configuration. Runs only if the ghost is not in frightened mode.

      • generateNextMove

        public Movable.Direction generateNextMove(int targetx,
                                          int targety)
        Generates next move given a list of preferences for direction of travel. Please consult the generatePreferences(Direction, int[]) function for more information on how preferences are generated.
        Parameters:
        targetx - x coordinate of target
        targety - y coordinate of target
        Returns:
        Returns the next direction the ghost will move in.

      • canChangeDirection

        public boolean canChangeDirection()
        Check that ghost is at an intersection, and completely within a grid, so it can change direction.
        Returns:
        True if the ghost is allowed to change direction, false if not.

      • canGoDirection

        Determine if can go in a particular direction based on wall locations
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • generateVectors

        public abstract int[] generateVectors(int targetx,
                                      int targety)
        Generate the vector to the target location, individual to each ghost type.
        Parameters:
        targetx - x coordinate of target
        targety - y coordinate of target
        Returns:
        array of two integers, with the first being the horizontal component of the vector and the second being the vertical component

      • generatePreferences

        public java.util.ArrayList<Movable.Direction> generatePreferences(Movable.Direction direction,
                                                                  int[] vector)
        Generate list of moves based on intended vector in preferred order. Takes into account the ghost's direction and a vector. The vector is generated by the generateVectors function which is unique to each ghost type. If the ghost is in frightened mode, the preference list is shuffled to randomise the movement.
        Parameters:
        Direction - The ghost's current direction of travel.
        vector - A two integer array which has a vertical and horizontal component aimed at the target direction.
        Returns:
        An array list of directions, with the first index corresponding to the most preferred direction and the last being the least. The last vector is always the current direction of travel.

      • checkIfFrightened

        public void checkIfFrightened()
        Timer for frightened mode, if the ghost is in frightened mode. Once the timer exprires, the original mode is restored, and the frightened counter is reset back to zero.

      • restartGhost

        public void restartGhost()
        Restart ghost when the game is restarting. Restores the start coordinate and state, resets the mode counters and mode length pointer.
